alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps; Sherman; Valley (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued August 23 at 4:24AM CDT until August 24 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Multiple days of very hot conditions with afternoon and early evening heat index values of 100 to around 105 degrees expected. * WHERE...Valley, Sherman, Dawson, Buffalo, Gosper, Phelps, Kearney, Furnas, Harlan and Franklin Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Overnight temperatures will only fall into the 70s, providing only limited relief from the heat. South- southwesterly winds of 5 to 20 MPH are expected today, providing at least some degree of relief.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Franklin; Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps; Sherman; Valley
